model_solution:
Since $\triangle ABC$ is isosceles with $AC=BC$, $\angle ACB=\angle CAB=70^\circ$.
Since $\angle ACB$ and $\angle ABC$ are supplementary, $\angle ABC=180^\circ-70^\circ-70^\circ=40^\circ$.
steps: Since $\triangle ABC$ is isosceles with $AC=BC$, $\angle ACB=\angle CAB=70^\circ$.
Since $\angle ACB$ and $\angle ABC$ are supplementary, $\angle ABC=180^\circ-70^\circ-70^\circ=40^\circ$.
full_steps: Since $\triangle ABC$ is isosceles with $AC=BC$, $\angle ACB=\angle CAB=70^\circ$.
Since $\angle ACB$ and $\angle ABC$ are supplementary, $\angle ABC=180^\circ-70^\circ-70^\circ=40^\circ$.
